content:
If you use the card view you need to mess around on various menus

If you are using the list/table view you just click on the list heading you want to sort by and repeat to reverse the sort on that item.

The arrow on the heading shows the direction of the sort if the column in sorted already.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: When attempting to reinstall for a clean restart, be sure to delete the appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder, as that is where all settings are stored.
creator: davidsk

content: This thread, worded somewhat differently from yours, is essentially the same problem. Please review and post any questions by here on this thread. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1564841 in summary, the steps are - create manual filter, if needed, to COPY to local folders (not move) - then delete from server

content:
In compose screen, click Options>Return Receipt If menu bar is not visible, press alt key first

Reminder: many users have this feature turned off. There is no assurance that you will receive a receipt, as the process is voluntary. Also, many email providers now disregard the requests, as they are often spam.
creator: davidsk

content: Please post a screenshot of what you see, and I will attempt to suggest an alternate layout view. Also, the donation request is a standing request, as your copy of Thunderbird is unaware of your donation. To keep Thunderbird active and supported, donations are needed on a regular basis, so the request is always realistic. That is, although your donation is much appreciated, we hope you will do this periodically. To remove the donation request, you can click to settings>general and untick the startup page.
creator: davidsk

content: Are you just wanting to change the name of the person on the account? If so, click 'account settings', highlight the account name in left side bar, and on right side is the box for 'your name.' Just overtype with your name.

content: In IMAP, sync'ing is to the server. what is deleted from PC is deleted from server.
creator: davidsk

content: Right. So my local Sent Items should show much more emails. But it doesn't. Or is there a "compress" setting which deletes mails older than 30 days? It can't be a coincidence that my local mails are 30 days old at maximum - just like remote mail server settings were.
creator: asbach2

content: I am not sure I understand. If this is an IMAP account and you have retention set to 30 days, that keeps messages on PC and on server at the same retention.
creator: davidsk

content: My assumption was just like you said first: In IMAP, sync'ing is _to_ the server. what is deleted from PC is deleted from server. But what is deleted from the server still stays on the local PC. I'm wrong here? Any way of changing this behavivor with IMAP?
creator: asbach2

content: It isn't thunderbird; it' the IMAP protocol. What is on the PC is only for ready reference. the 'official' version of the message is on the server. Easily misunderstood. I have seen people delete messages from server and then log onto thunderbird and discover that the copies on PC suddenly disappeared. It can't be changed. If you need copies locally and want online version deleted, you need to copy to Local Folders prior to deleting.
creator: davidsk

Maybe it's just me but I can see no sense in deleting local Sent Items at all.

content: to locate your SMTP server settings; - click account settings - highlight the account name in left sidebar - on lower right side of screen is a button 'edit SMTP server' click that
creator: davidsk
